docs.snippet: The Bagger answers a reader's question about what Sony Pictures Classics has done to get people to watch "Animal Kingdom."...
docs.lead_paragraph: In doing the Q&A thing with readers, it's pretty hard to avoid the "Yes, Virginia, there is a " style of reply ("Yes, Virginia, there is a Weinstein "), but rest assured, the Bagger is trying. A lot of folks have written us asking about the Academy members' viewing habits.
docs.abstract: The Bagger answers a reader's question about what Sony Pictures Classics has done to get people to watch "Animal Kingdom."

byline.original: By A. O. SCOTT and MANOHLA DARGIS

docs.snippet: Beginning March 22, the Roundabout production will be joined by Jayne Houdyshell (as Miss Prism), Brian Murray (as Reverend Canon Chasuble) and Jessie Austrian (as Gwendolyn Fairfax)....
docs.lead_paragraph: To lose one parent, Lady Bracknell declares in "The Importance of Being Earnest," may be regarded as a misfortune and to lose both looks like carelessness. But the loss of three performers from Roundabout Theater Company's Broadway revival of that Oscar Wilde comedy is an inevitability. Though it was recently announced that "Earnest" would extend its run at the American Airlines Theater through July 3, the cast members Dana Ivey (who plays Miss Prism), Paxton Whitehead (Rev. Canon Chasuble) and Sara Topham (Gwendolen Fairfax) are set to depart after the March 20 performance.
docs.abstract: Beginning March 22, the Roundabout production will be joined by Jayne Houdyshell (as Miss Prism), Brian Murray (as Reverend Canon Chasuble) and Jessie Austrian (as Gwendolyn Fairfax).

headline.main: New 'Earnest' Cast Members Named for Broadway

docs.snippet: Raul de Molina, one half of "El Gordo y La Flaca," was as surprised as anyone that he liked "Black Swan" so much....
docs.lead_paragraph: Viewers of Univision, the Spanish-language network, know Raúl de Molina, a veteran journalist, as El Gordo. With Lili Estefan, the Cuban-born Mr. de Molina is a host of "El Gordo y la Flaca," a wildly popular daily talk show on Univision that has made him a well-known personality in the Spanish-speaking world. Mr. de Molina is also a contributor to The Huffington Post, where he writes about food and health, and an inveterate world traveler (even though he was almost mauled by lions while on safari last year). He filled out our Oscar ballot, and when the Bagger spoke with him from his home in Miami, he wasted no time in sharing his picks.
docs.abstract: Raul de Molina, one half of "El Gordo y La Flaca," was as surprised as anyone that he liked "Black Swan" so much.

headline.main: Oscar Picks, Courtesy of Univision's El Gordo

docs.snippet: Kristen Schaal, author, contributor to "The Daily Show" and a voice in the "Toy Story 3" crowd, explains her choices in The Times's interactive Oscar ballot....
docs.lead_paragraph: For the second installment of our celebrity Oscar ballot and questionnaire, we're allowing a little bias. Kristen Schaal, best known as the ardent fan Mel on the HBO series "Flight of the Conchords" and as a correspondent on "The Daily Show With Jon Stewart," voices Trixie the triceratops in "Toy Story 3," an Oscar nominee this year. She also stars as Louise in the new animated series Bob's Burgers on Fox, and is the author, with Rich Blomquist, a "Daily Show" writer who also happens to be her boyfriend, of "The Sexy Book of Sex Sex." Ms. Schaal, who is not (we repeat, not an Academy member), is also a longtime pal of the Bagger's. We spoke to her about her Oscar choices in an interview conducted in the most informal way possible, over Instant Message.
docs.abstract: Kristen Schaal, author, contributor to "The Daily Show" and a voice in the "Toy Story 3" crowd, explains her choices in The Times's interactive Oscar ballot.

headline.main: Oscar Picks, From the Voice of Trixie from 'Toy Story'

docs.snippet: The Academy is taking its new mandate to be more open and revealing, with a new video and plan to include fans on the red carpet (at least virtually)....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Academy is really taking its new mandate to be more open and revealing than ever before seriously. In a new promo, Anne Hathaway, who is co-hosting the evening with James Franco, is shown practicing her Teleprompter lines, and today the group announced that even average movie fans will have a spot on the red carpet - via questions they submit on Twitter or Facebook, of course.
docs.abstract: The Academy is taking its new mandate to be more open and revealing, with a new video and plan to include fans on the red carpet (at least virtually).

headline.main: An Oscar Peek Behind the Scenes

docs.snippet: As the deadline approaches for Oscar ballots, the folks who spend their days attempting to divine the Oscar tea leaves offer up their choices for the big prizes....
docs.lead_paragraph: It's like a more glamorous tax day: the Oscar ballots are due today, by 5 p.m. in the offices of PricewaterhouseCoopers in Los Angeles. (And the hard deadline matters; like recalcitrant high school seniors working on their college apps, every year there are some stragglers who wait until the last minute and must hand-deliver.) For the rest of the week, in their famously undisclosed location, the accountants will tabulate and retabulate. Which leaves the rest of us free to speculate and hypothesize.
docs.abstract: As the deadline approaches for Oscar ballots, the folks who spend their days attempting to divine the Oscar tea leaves offer up their choices for the big prizes.
